articles.title: Nations Who Fail to Curb Fossil Fuels Could Be Ordered to Pay Reparations, Top UN Court Rules
articles.description: The International Court of Justice ruled that countries must prevent harm to the climate system, and failing to do so could result in them being ordered to pay compensation and make other forms of restitution.

articles.title: Protests Break Out Against Zelensky in Ukraine
articles.description: Protests erupted against Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky after he signed a bill that critics say weakens the country's anti-corruption agencies, effectively placing them under the control of the prosecutor general.

articles.title: White House Cuts Artificial Intelligence Regulations to Compete with China
articles.description: The White House announced a reduction in artificial intelligence regulations in an effort to compete with China in a technological arms race.
